content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Block Count & Layers
The target structure appears to be a small house-like construction with the following elements:
- 3 distinct layers of blocks
- Approximately 9-10 individual blocks in total
- Features a circular tunnel/doorway in the front

## Spatial Relationships
The structure consists of:
- Base layer: Red blocks forming a tunnel/archway with triangular orange supports on both sides
- Middle layer: Yellow cylindrical/half-cylindrical blocks sitting on top of the red base
- Top layer: An orange triangular roof piece

# Selection of Required Blocks

Based on my analysis, the following blocks from the dictionary are needed:

1. For the base layer:
   - Block #1 (Red archway/tunnel block)
   - Block #2 (Red curved block) for one side of the tunnel
   - Block #3 (Red curved block) for the other side of the tunnel
   - Block #13 (Orange triangular support) for the left side
   - Block #15 (Orange triangular support) for the right side

2. For the middle layer:
   - Block #6 (Yellow half-cylinder) for one side
   - Block #7 (Yellow half-cylinder) for the other side

3. For the top layer:
   - Block #12 (Orange triangular roof piece)

# Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 1
    Step2: Move block with index 2
    Step3: Move block with index 3
    Step4: Move block with index 13
    Step5: Move block with index 15
    Step6: Move block with index 6
    Step7: Move block with index 7
    Step8: Move block with index 12
}
```

This assembly order builds the structure from the bottom up, starting with the central tunnel piece, adding the side pieces of the tunnel, then the triangular supports, followed by the yellow cylindrical pieces on top, and finally placing the triangular roof.
